Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC>20.8 µM), Escherichia coli (MIC=20.8 µM);Gram-positive bacteria:Enterococcus faecalis (MIC=1.3 µM), Bacillus subtilis (MIC=5.2 µM), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=5.2 µM), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=2.6 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: Disrupts cell membranes through formation of pores.

Literature.Title: Characterization of unique amphipathic antimicrobial peptides from venom of the scorpion Pandinus imperator.
Literature.Author: Corzo G, Escoubas P, Villegas E, Barnham KJ, He W, Norton RS, Nakajima T.

Literature.Title: Induction of morphological changes in model lipid membranes and the mechanism of membrane disruption by a large scorpion-derived pore-forming peptide.
Literature.Author: Nomura K, Ferrat G, Nakajima T, Darbon H, Iwashita T, Corzo G.
